preprocS2 1.2.3

  • Articles
    • Copernicus Academy biodiv#1: download

Reference

All functions

adjust_ENVI_hdr()

This function adjusts information from ENVI header

check_S2mission()

This function saves reflectance files

dir_size()

this function aims at computing directory size

extract_from_S2_L2A()

This function reads S2 data from L2A directories downloaded from various data hubs including THEIA, PEPS & SCIHUB (SAFE format & LaSRC)

get_BB()

This function gets coordinates of a bounding box defined by a vector (optional) and a raster

get_BB_from_fullImage()

This function gets extreme coordinates of a bounding box corresponding to a full image

get_BB_from_Vector()

This gets bounding box corresponding to a vector from a raster (UL, UR, LL, LR corners)

get_date()

This function gets acquisition date from S2 image

get_datetime_from_S2prod()

Using the PRODUCT_ID, this function help to recreate correctly start, stop and generation date in the XML programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

get_HDR_name()

get hdr name from image file name, assuming it is BIL format

get_S2_bands()

This function returns path for the spectral bands to be used

get_S2_bands_from_LaSRC()

This function returns path for the spectral bands in LaSRC directory

get_S2_bands_from_RGEE()

This function returns path for the spectral bands in GEE directory programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

get_S2_bands_from_Sen2Cor()

This function returns path for the spectral bands in SAFE / sen2Cor directory

get_S2_bands_from_THEIA()

This function returns path for the spectral bands in THEIA directory

get_S2_L1C_Image()

download S2 L1C data from Copernicus hub or Google Cloud

get_S2_L2A_Image()

download S2 L2A data from Copernicus hub or convert L1C to L2A

get_S2_L2A_Image_from_GEE()

This function downloads S2 data from GEE based on a vector footprint

get_S2_level()

This function check S2 data level:

  • L2A: already atmospherically corrected

  • L1C: requires atmospheric corrections with sen2cor

get_tile()

This function gets tile from S2 image

granuleIdentifier_creation()

This function was made to correctly create the granule line corresponding to a RGEE data acquisition programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

identification_Acq_features()

This function is used to find the good features data for an acquisition programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

ind2sub()

convert image coordinates from index to X-Y

mosaic_rasters()

mosaicing a set of rasters

read_ENVI_header()

Reads ENVI hdr file

read_raster()

This function reads a raster stack, and gets footprint as pixel coordinates or vector file as input

read_S2bands()

This function reads a list of files corresponding to S2 bands S2 bands are expected to have uniform spatial resolution and footprint

recup_name_crs()

With the ESPG, this function writes the CRS name corresponding programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

reproject_shp()

This function reprojects a shapefile and saves reprojected shapefile

S2_band_StandardizeName()

This function standardizes S2 band names downloaded with GEE (from BX to B0X) programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

S2_from_L1C_to_L2A()

perform atmospheric corrections to convert L1C to L2A data with Sen2cor

save_cloud_s2()

This function saves cloud masks. 'CloudMask_Binary' is default binary mask with 0 where clouds are detected and 1 for clean pixels 'CloudMask_RAW' is the original cloud layer produced by atmospheric correction algorithm --> may be useful to refine cloud mask

save_reflectance_s2()

This function saves reflectance files

split_line()

ENVI functions

vectorize_raster_extent()

save raster footprint as vector file

write_ENVI_header()

writes ENVI hdr file

write_rasterStack_ENVI()

This function writes a raster Stack object into a ENVI raster file

write_Stack_S2()

This function writes a stars object into a raster file

write_template_MSIL2A()

This function is made to correctly create the MTD_MSIL2A.xml for each dnowloaded date using the MTD_MSIL2A.xml template programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

write_template_TL()

This function is made to correctly create the MTD_TL.xml for each dnowloaded date using the MTD_TL.xml template programmed by romain.dous@inrae.fr

Contents

Developed by Jean-Baptiste Feret.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
